Starfields

--About--

The idea for this project stemmed from an interest in astronomy and the “fun fact” that what you think your zodiac sign is, likely isn’t your actual one. In order to implement the idea, we took inspiration from programs like Stellarium and SkyView which allow you to view the night sky on a particular day. Since the focus of the program is on astrology and determining zodiac signs, the position of the sun is what needed to be plotted. Using public data from [INSERT NAME HERE], we were able to retrieve the position of the sun in celestial coordinates depending on the date, and then plot it relative to the stars and constellations.

Contributors:


  Nathan Getchel - Data/Progamming
  Aaron Nezzer - Programming
  Mercy Tangredi - Writing/Design

  The base code for projecting and plotting the sun and stars in 3D interactive form comes from GitHub user Sean-Bradley’s program “Three.js-TypeScript-Boilerplate.”
